full_history.content: What are the requirements for connecting beams to columns in cast-in-place concrete frames under the Virginia Building Code?

The Virginia Building Code (specifically the Virginia Uniform Statewide Building Code - USBC) relies heavily on the International Building Code (IBC) and referenced standards like ACI 318 for the design and construction of cast-in-place concrete beam-column connections.  While the provided research excerpts from the Virginia Construction Code itself don't offer specific requirements for beam-column connections, they clarify how the code hierarchy works. The Virginia Construction Code (VCC) gives precedence to Chapter 1 and the state amendments to the IBC.  Where these are silent, the IBC and its referenced standards, such as ACI 318, govern ([https://www.dhcd.virginia.gov/sites/default/files/DocX/building-codes-regulations/archive-codes/2021/2021-virginia-construction-code.pdf]). This means that the specific requirements for beam-column connections are found within ACI 318, which the VCC adopts by reference.
